author: quasar
title: Mechanism Templates for Funding
description: Текущий механизм финансирования Catalyst не может способствовать быстрому финансированию из-за инфраструктуры ideascale.

f6_assessments.q0: К сожалению, я не думаю, что это предложение полезно для экосистемы Cardano и хорошо соответствует целям задачи. Начиная с того, что это нечто очень широкое. Участник хочет создать дискорд-сервер для обсуждения и вместе с этим решения нескольких проблем Catalyst, приведенных на сайте, который мы не смогли открыть (появляется сообщение об ошибке). При этом ни разу не говорится о более быстрых, эффективных и прозрачных способах распределения сокровищ Catalyst и вознаграждения профессионалов, участвующих в различных видах деятельности экосистемы, о чем говорится в заявке. Мне кажется, что инициатор хочет решить много проблем сразу, но без фокуса и подробного плана действий невозможно быть уверенным, что какая-либо из этих проблем действительно будет решена. Это все равно, что обещать много, но не представить аргументов, как это сделать. Кроме того, что в фондах финансирования уже есть место для сообщения о проблемах; это не было бы чем-то новым, я думаю. Таким образом, нет, предложение не отвечает целям задачи и не похоже на то, что оно может быть профинансировано.
f6_assessments.q1: Сторонник утверждает, что он довольно активен в сообществе. Однако, кем может быть "Кардано Евангелиста"? Тот факт, что он является CA и администратором дискорд-сервера (какого?), к сожалению, не делает его подготовленным к решению проблем, поскольку такие проблемы будут разной природы, и мне кажется, что у нас есть автор, который очень хорошо разбирается в основах Cardano, но это не обязательно показывает техническую подготовку для решения различных ситуаций. Я думаю, было бы более уместно, если бы он создал команду, с профессионалами из разных областей знаний, то есть разработчиками, дизайнерами, рекламщиками и т.д., таким образом, возможно, спектр вариантов мог бы удовлетворить потребности рассматриваемых проблем. Нам также было бы важно знать, какое предложение он профинансировал, он разместил свой профиль на ideascale, но через страницу невозможно сделать вывод о том, каким было его успешное предложение. Что касается сценария, к сожалению, здесь также нет информации. У нас нет определения этапов, которые должны быть выполнены, мы не знаем, какие шаги пропонент предпримет для достижения успеха, мы не знаем, какие действия будут выполнены, в каком порядке и почему. Нет возможности понять процесс. Финансирование также не было обосновано. Почему 9 тысяч? Это зарплата участника тендера? Но относительно скольких часов работы? Сколько времени разрабатывалось бы это предложение? Мне неприятно это говорить, но эта тема предложения совершенно беспомощна: мы не понимаем, почему автор готов выполнить предложение; нет сценария; нет обоснования запрашиваемых денег.
f6_assessments.q2: ВНИМАНИЕ: этот участник скопировал и вставил в часть предложения "Ключевые показатели для измерения" то, что указано в описании задачи. Учитывая это, рассматривать здесь нечего. Он не продумал свое предложение уникальным образом, не продумал способы его аудита, он просто использовал готовые модели, имеющиеся в ideascale. Нет никакого способа провести аудит этого предложения. Создание канала discord было бы основным видом деятельности здесь, идеальным вариантом было бы, если бы сторонник собрал основные дебаты и информацию, сказанную на его канале, и передал этот контент остальному сообществу Cardano, или даже кто-то из членов сообщества участвовал в канале для осуществления живого отслеживания. Но, к сожалению, он не беспокоится о поиске решений для аудита, он просто пользуется готовыми моделями, как он сказал ранее.

f6_assessments.q0: There are no real details here on what is actually going to be provided, most of the proposal is just a reference to the challenge itself and other documents. Why do you need $9000 to set up a discord server? Whilst I have yet to go through all the proposals from QUASAR in this fund, I did so In fund6 and they were all of a similarly vague format. Please provide a concrete proposal with clear deliverables and time frames.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no clear plan presented. Part of the main experience presented is that the proposer has submitted 50 ideas and had 1 funded. This in itself says something about how the proposals were perceived. I remember reviewing all the ideas by QUASAR in fund 6, and reading all the other reviewers comments on their proposals in the voting stage. The proposals were all relatively vague, with difference expertise stated for each one with no evidence to back them up. They were rated poorly by all reviewers. I have little confidence this proposer will successfully deliver on this proposal given this history and the limited details provided in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear deliverables or associate timeframes. No metrics for success have been presented. Please provide a clear timeline of what you will deliver by when so delivery can be audited. Please also provide some clear metrics with attached goals so that success can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement regards the constraints imposed by ideascale and proposes some side solutions to overcome them such as a discord server and other mechanisms. Although the global idea and problem statement seems to fit within the challenge goal, the proposal did not address with clarity how the problem will be solved. It shows two examples of possible mechanisms, one is a tweeter event and the other is related to an identity token, but couldn't grasp the linkage to the general idea. I'd suggest elaborate the idea with more details and concrete examples.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is composed of well known and accountable members of this community with at least one proposal funded. However the proposal laks details and concrete action plan; it provides an overall budget with no breakdown or explanation; it doesn't provide timelines; and KPI/metrics are missing. With the lack of this critical information it is impossible to evaluate positively. I recommend elaborating the proposal in more detail following the guidelines and assistance from the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is not well developed, it looks like a good idea that needs a lot of refinement. The authors need to work on to show accountability to the community. The project does not include metrics or KPI to track progress, not even show an action plan with due dates. It is also not easy to understand what the concrete solution is. For the lack of this critical information I can not evaluate that this proposal can be audited in case of being funded.

f6_assessments.q0: Primarily, there is no a description of the structure of the templates or mechanisms that would facilitate the rapid funding of proposals.  Without such a description, it is difficult to establish how the templates or mechanisms of the current proposal would be a better instrument compared to the current process developed through Ideascale.  The links provided do not offer a clear idea of the structure of the tools that are intended to be built, therefore, I believe it is difficult for the reader and will be difficult for the voter to understand and imagine the potential impact of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
- Without a clear understanding of the impact of the proposal, it will therefore be difficult to establish its feasibility. And unknown feasibility means no feasibility. And, as I mentioned in the "Impact" section, in my opinion, lack of understanding of impact is due to lack of at least a basic description of the structure of the tools that the proposal intends to build.

- Please provide information about the other team members (academic formation, experience, etc)

- There is no detailed description of the budget.
f6_assessments.q2: Are the suggested KPIs intended to measure the performance of the proposal or the characteristics of proposals applying for fast-track funding? It is difficult to establish the measurement scenario.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement isn't defined very well. It is a general statement that Ideascale is not a good enough infrastructure to facilitate rapid funding, but it doesn't specify which parts of Ideascale should be improved, and in what way, to improve this.

They write that they will test governance and identity solutions for proposals on a discord servers. These solutions should have been explained more in detail to make it possible to assess the impact of their proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no explanation of what the budget will be used for, and in what timeframe. 

Based on the lack of detailed explanation in the proposal, I didn't get the impression that the proposers have a high level of commitment towards the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
They haven't specified well enough what kinds of mechanisms and templates they will build (or which specific problems they will solve), thus it is very difficult for the community to assess the success and impact of what they create.

They haven't stated any specific metrics that defines what it would look like if this project was implemented successfully. They have simply copy-pasted the text from the campaign brief, not addressed how they will approach these questions specifically.

No roadmap or milestones included, this makes it impossible for the community to audit the progress.

f6_assessments.q0: "The solution will be a discord server to test alternative goverance and identity solutions", it states. However, the Discord invite link is expired.
f6_assessments.q1: As is the case with many of the prior proposals from this particular proposer, it is a bit difficult to pinpoint what exactly is being proposed. A bunch of links leading here and there is hardly a proposal. Not sure if this is a merit: "50+ Proposals submitted, 1 funded, 50% delivered".
f6_assessments.q2: Rather than showing a roadmap or KPIs, the proposer has just copy-pasted measures from the challenge itself.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is a well respected member of the community and the proposal is aimed at dealing with the challenge. However, the proposal is a Discord server where the actual solutions will be discussed, therefore more of an indirect benefit. Key metrics are very broad, almost as the challenge itself. I did not manage to find the clear value in the proposal except as enabling space where the actual solutions referring to the challenge might be tested&explored. To my understanding, the challenge should asses already the solutions, not the forum to discuss solutions.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a technical part which is setting up a Discord and then a human part where solutions to the actual challenge shall be discussed. There are many risks in this proposal due to unknowns in the acceptance of the new platform and actual good ideas being born there. The risk of lack of people or good proposals actually emerging has not been addressed. I would assume that the Challenge goal would be more in the direction of already solid solutions. The budget is a lump sum with no breakdown or milestones in itself, more related to the solutions to be tested. The proposer is experienced and valued Cardano community member, so there is a high possibility of delivering if funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has key metrics which are related to the solutions to be tested. It is a bit difficult to measure the deliverables since it will be mostly descriptory, not a solution ready to be implemented and impact measured. Time horizon or milestones are not clearly defined. If the selected solutions are to be implemented, there would be a way to measure and compare to Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0:
Unfortunately, the links provided with the list of itens to be addressed in this proposal are not available and, hence, it becomes really hard to assess its potential. As suggestions, I'd try to include at least some examples in the proposal body to avoid issues like this. 

In addition, the proposal is really vague on how they intend to address these issues (whatever they are) with no clear strategy or plan. It just says its going to multiple mechanisms and template but it doesnt tell how. It would be imporant to have mentioned here how the interaction with community/users/stakeholders would occur and what would be the chosen approach to do so. It is also mentioned that the solution is based on a discord server to test alternative governance but it doesnt explain why it chosen or how they would be tested.
f6_assessments.q1:
In regard to the team, it is not mentioned how many people are involved and the experience described is a bit vague, with no links provided to verify the info. It would be important to tell a bit more what proposer technical background is and what is its experience in establishing governance.

There's also no plan defined nor a budget breakdown. As to the plan, it would be imporant to include how the itents in the list would be prioritized (planning phase), how they would be tackled (development), tested in the community (validation) and rolled out (implementation), all distribuited along weeks/months and with clear deliverables. For the budget breakdown, it could be splitted into working hours and necessary tools, for instance.
f6_assessments.q2:
Theres a KPI section but the content in it is too subjective and has no really measurable KPIs. It would be imporant to see how many itens they addressed, the quality of the solutions and how many users they intend to reach. If possible, with clear targets and the evolution over time.
As theres no plan, there are also no milestones as well.  If a proper schedule were made available, it wouyld be important to see the main milestone in each project phase highlighted.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem described is inline with the challenge expectations, but I believe that the lack of rapidity may not rely only on the Ideascale infrastructure. But the solution proposed to test other governance model shows that it is not only the infrastructure the only issue.
f6_assessments.q1: A budget breakdown and a timeline are missing. The provided links are not working and the presentation of the team members is missing.
f6_assessments.q2: From my point of view the provided KPI are not all auditable. The team members should describe what "Fast" means (in terms of days or weeks or months). Is Fast meaning 7 days, 2 days, 2 weeks, etc?

solution: Решением станет дискорд-сервер для тестирования альтернативных решений по управлению и идентификации.
experience: В Catalyst в качестве пропозиционера, советника, челлендж-команды. Евангелист Cardano, администратор в discord. Подано 50+ предложений, 1 профинансировано, 50% реализовано.
